data.title: LiTT Line
data.meta_description:
More than a festival it's a REVOLUTION 
Aug 29th thru Sept 1st
Leland Lake 
*260 Munn rd Quilcene*
data.text:
What they bring.. “Shamanic Sound healing and Energy clearing” with Kundalini Yoga, Gong, Didgeridoo, and Drums."

In Their words..."Our sound healing offerings start with a group vision discussion, breath work, and movement which then is combined with song, prayer, and play. We form sacred resonance with our tools of voice and instrument to bring about a structural change in the energy body and space with healing intention."

Julieth Dauble spiritual name Metsa Noma "shiny woman"

A world traveler born and raised in Colombia with roots in Hawaii and the Pacific Northwest, she follows the path of healing with plants, energy and sound. Specializing in utilizing herbal teas and alternative therapies with a love of healing and service.

Matthew Dauble spiritual name Ronin Mane “flying anaconda”

Matthew is a dedicated Curandero and certified Kundalini Yoga teacher, singer songwriter, and father. He facilitates healing in service to the greater awakening of life, love, and happiness. His life long passion has been that of a spiritual journey through a combination of traditional yoga and shamanism practices.

Dikla started practicing yoga in 2003 after many years of practicing martial arts. She wanted to find something softer but still challenging that would support her new lifestyle and career. She stepped into her first yoga class and fell in love immediately! Over the years she practiced many styles of yoga, including Ashtanga, Iyengar and Sivananda.

Her first TT was Ashtanga, back in Tel Aviv, Israel, right after her first pregnancy. Dikla practiced the full primary series during her second pregnancy. Here in the US she has completed 200h Hatha yoga TT with HYI, 200h Vinyasa TT with Les Leventhal – 95h TT certification in Yin with Ali Valdez, and 500h advanced studies with Sattva Yoga.

Dikla teaches Ashtanga, Vinyasa and Hatha yoga, as well as Yoga Philosophy, and the thing she loves the most is challenging students and reminding them how strong they are. "I encourage students to come to the mat every day! Even if its just for a few minutes, for 3 of their favorite poses, or a couple of sun salutes. I strongly believe that daily practice is important and want to encourage everyone to explore the discipline of self-practice."

Nancy Nomeliini is the Founder and director of Mother Yoga located in the heart of Chinatown International District in Seattle Washington, a sliding scale studio and school devoted to imparting the teachings of YOGA for the Greater Good for All.

She believes in the power of community to transform lives and Yoga as a tool for ending suffering through collective healing.

Nancy is celebrated for her uplifting , creative and soulful teachings. Her classes are thoughtful, transformative and spiritually charged! She weaves in the dharma of yogic philosophy integrating wise and innovative sequencing throughout her classes.

She is a highly sought after yoga "teachers teacher " leading 200 and 300 hour teacher training programs in Seattle , Portland and San Francisco.

Nancy leads annual pilgrimages to INDIA for spiritual seekers as well as retreats around the world to deepen our connection with ourselves and with nature. She also teaches weekly classes and workshops at her home base studio in Seattle called Mother Yoga.

motheryogaseattle.com

The daughter of a jazz pianist, Marti Nikko spent her childhood in nightclubs, absorbing the art and wisdom of many great musicians. Enthralled by what she heard, she began to sing and perform her own music, infusing her innate grasp of jazz and soul into a warm, natural voice.

Marti met DJ Drez shortly after high school, when they began performing and recording together. Over two decades, their collaboration has become an intimate musical language that effortlessly translates into and between many styles of music, including hip hop, reggae, kirtan, jazz and soul. Listen to any of DJ Drez’s albums and you’ll hear Marti Nikko’s unmistakably rich and nuanced voice. Her full-length albums, Dreaming In Sanskrit on Black Swan Sounds, Explorers of Infinity and Dreaming in Sanskrit Verse Two on Nectar Drop, combines her instinctive musicality with deeply devoted mantra practice.

In addition to Marti’s talents as a singer, songwriter and performer, she teaches yoga and pilates around the world and in the Bay Area where she and Drez live and love their 18-year-old son and 5-year-old baby girl.

Mahalakshmi weaves poetic lyrics into catchy melodies while accompanying herself on keyboard (piano). She writes music in service to humanity, with messages of hope and sanity, of Truth, Simplicity, and Love. She also performs & leads groups in original and traditional kirtan, an extremely healing & transformative practice of singing the names and attributes of the Divine in Sanskrit.

She and Emam also join forces in a band called RYTHYM & MANTRA where they perform traditional & originally composed devotional fusion music from the heart. Early in life, Mahalakshmi discovered a lifeline in music. Divine music came to her ear beyond any conscious intent and often arrived with words and chords complete.

It was through sound that she discovered bliss and peace. This internal discovery was and is a continual uncovering of treasure. Her clear and direct work in this life is to write and perform music that bathes herself and the listener in beauty and truth.

Writing remains an output of her creativity, however, the only medium that fully expresses her innermost self is music.Mahalakshmi wishes to gift the world this music as it comes from the place where we all meet as one in our shared humanity, with pure intention of heart.

She is a reiki healer

and music is an extension of her healing practice.

For over three decades, Emam has united musicians from diverse musical styles and cultures to record, produce, and perform original compositions. For many years, the ensemble was known as Emam & Friends.

Since 1979, he has been devoted to learning the tabla, and in 1989, he established a world music label, Eternal Music. To date, he has produced 23 albums under this label, including 17 Emam & Friends albums, as well as albums by Pandit Hariprasad Chaurasia and Ustad Zakir Hussain.

In 2013, Emam met Mahalakshmi, and married six years later. I Born in Iran, Emam migrated to the United States in 1974. His first visit to India was in 1978. Since then he has immersed himself in the music and the culture of India.

Emam has been trained in North Indian Classical drumming by the grand masters of tabla: Ustad Alla Rakha and Ustad Zakir Hussain. He also studied the Delhi Gharana of tabla with the late Ustad Inam Ali Khan.

In 1991, he was awarded a scholarship for study of music in India by the American Institute of Indian Studies with funding from the Smithsonian Institute. The results were a book called "Delhi Gharana of Tabla (a Compositional Documentation)", as well as music albums which were released by Magnasound.

Since 2011, Emam has been living in North Goa with

his wife and music partner Mahalakshmi.

"You have to resurrect the deep pain within you and give it a place to live that is not within your body. Let it live in writing. Let it live in music. Let it be devoured by building brighter connections. Your body is not a coffin for pain to be buried in. Put it somewhere else." Ehimeora

Kylee is a certified Creative Grief Support Pract

"You have to resurrect the deep pain within you and give it a place to live that is not within your body. Let it live in writing. Let it live in music. Let it be devoured by building brighter connections. Your body is not a coffin for pain to be buried in. Put it somewhere else." Ehimeora

Kylee is a certified Creative Grief Support Practitioner, Owner of Sacred Dwelling Healing Arts Center, and Community Space Holder. She is also certified in Grief Movement Therapy and accompanies others as a Grief Doula. After the loss of her son, Oliver, she has been following the calling to support others’ grief journeys. Kylee studied Aikido for ten years and is a life-long learner & practitioner of yoga, mindfulness/meditation, along with facilitating emotional growth programs. She formerly worked in the field of International Education as an Advisor and Field Instructor. She holds space with love and compassion while providing expressive therapeutic modalities that encompass meaning-making, integration, creative exploration, and growth. She works with individuals one on one and facilitates grief circles and workshops that focus on ritual therapeutics, ceremony, creativity, connection, and Earth psychology based healing modalities.

HOME | Sacred Dwelling (sacreddwellingllc.com)

I’m Audrey | Yoga Instructor, Soul Mentor, Podcaster, Writer & New Mom

About – Audrey Sutton Mills

I know what it’s like to feel unfulfilled, alone, and not good enough. I’ve taken the hard journey of leaving a life I thought I wanted to discover the life I was destined to live. I’m here to help YOU walk the path of deeper self-love to the person YOU are meant to be. It’s my mission to inspire you to whole-heartedly love yourself, embody your worth and live your most expansive life. Take it from someone who’s been there.

Julia Buggy, E-RYT now owns Blue Mountain Yoga and Wellness Collective in Sequim, Washington on the Olympic Peninsula where she has taught yoga for 10 years. She enjoys sharing yoga and dance to deepen connection to the Earth, Self, and community. These modalities and time-honored traditions have been pricelessly instrumental in her healing and self-love journey, leading her from darkness to light suffering to Bliss. She is honored to share her passion for these holistic embodiment practices and 23 years of yoga with you at this year's LiTT Fest!

To read her full bio or learn more about her studio please visit:

https://www.juliabuggy.com/

https://www.facebook.com/BlueMountainYogaPlus

A proponent of holistic nutrition, Julia has been part of the supplement industry since 2006 and became a Holistic Nutrition Educator after graduating from Bauman College in 2009, following her studies in anatomy and pre-med/nutrition at Arizona State University.

She is a mother to two daughters and finds joy in dark chocolate, organic foods, outdoor excursions, dancing, and crafting jewelry.

Johanna Beekman is truly unique. Whether she's leading a kirtan, performing original music at a concert or festival, or guiding students through a Lullaby Yoga session, she touches hearts with her soulful music and uplifting spirit. Her velvety voice, creative interpretations of music from various world traditions, beautiful original songs, and open-hearted presence create unforgettable musical experiences.

Johanna wrote her first song at age 9 and had her first solo performance at 10, singing John Lennon's "Imagine" at a children's charity benefit. By 20, she had performed in clubs, coffee houses, colleges, benefit concerts, rallies, festivals, musical theatre, rock and world-beat bands, gospel and women's community choirs, improvisational acting and singing troupes, and films.

In recent years, Johanna has been a featured artist and singing yoga instructor at major yoga and music festivals across North America. She has collaborated with renowned musicians and yoga teachers. When not touring, she spends time in Oregon doing yoga, singing, and giving back to her community.

Johanna loves singing for yoga classes, especially Lullaby Yoga—her unique blend of music and restorative/yin yoga. In Lullaby Yoga, she gently guides participants through relaxing poses while singing and playing soothing songs and chants, creating a peaceful space for the mind to rest and the body to relax, rebalance, and restore itself.

She also provides music for RhythmAsana, a joyful blend of yoga, movement meditation, dance, and global rhythms. The band's mix of Johanna's originals and traditional music from around the world inspires both inner and outer movement.

As a Seattle native, I've been a part of the west coast music scene for three decades, DJing since the era of old school raves. My style is defined by squishy, undulating, tubular, and funky bass lines, blending genres like Breaks, Garage, Techno, House, Drum & Bass, 2-Step, Progressive, Trap, as well as Dub and other downbeat & chill-out genres. My performances are eclectic, rarely confined to a single genre. From 2001-2005, I headlined and organized club nights and events in Seattle and Portland before relocating my DJ career to Los Angeles. Although I stepped away from the scene in 2017 to embark on a new journey with holistic supplements at S.U.N. (Science Under Nature), the urge to animate dance floors has resurfaced. Get ready for the extraordinary as we create something truly unique together.
